title: Alisson among Liverpool trio set for extra training ahead of Man Utd clash

Alisson has remained at Melwood over the international break in an attempt to be fit for Liverpool's clash with Manchester United .

The Brazilian goalkeeper has been sidelined since picking up a calf injury in the opening match of the season against Norwich.

Adrian has filled in for the Liverpool No.1 and the performances of the ex-West Ham man have allowed Alisson to be eased back into action.

Speaking ahead of the win over Leicester , boss Jurgen Klopp admitted Alisson was close to returning.

And with his side heading to Old Trafford after the international break, the Reds goalkeeper is hoping to be involved.

(Image: Julian Hamilton/Daily Mirror)

Klopp has given those players not away with their countries the week off but Alisson is remaining at the club's training ground.

The stopper is working on his sharpness and wants to be in Klopp's thoughts for the clash with struggling Manchester United.

ESPN reports Adam Lallana and Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain have also decided to do additional training over the next week.

The pair have struggled for regular action after their respective injuries but are now back in Klopp's first-team plans.

(Image: PA)

Lallana and Oxlade-Chamberlain hope to use the break to step up their fitness with both said to have been told they have a big role to play this term.

Liverpool head to Old Trafford looking to make it nine wins out of nine at the start of the Premier League campaign.

Last weekend's dramatic victory over Leicester made it 17 successes on the spin for Klopp's men since the end of last term and opened up a gap on Manchester City at the top of the table.
description: Liverpool goalkeeper Alisson is keen to return to the side for the clash with Manchester United after the international break
